jobs.title: Head of Growth
jobs.description:
This role is for performance marketing experts with a track record of getting startups investment-ready. 

If this looks like the role for you, then apply via http://jobs.inthehiddencity.com/.

HiddenCity creates real-world adventure games for adults. Players solve clues, sent to their phone, on a journey through the city. They unlock secret locations, interact with people they meet, and solve challenges. There are currently nine games live in London which can be played every day of the week. Moriarty's Game is HiddenCity's most developed game, which sees players challenge Sherlock Holmes' nemesis. Players’ decisions influence where they go and the outcome of the story.

Following successful marketing tests run in Spring 2019, HiddenCity is looking for an expert in growth to build the business by a further 100% in the next 6-12 months. You'll provide data to support a business model, ready for investment, prior to global expansion, based on key growth metrics.

This role is for you if you:

Have a track record of getting startups investment-ready.

Have experience of managing an annual spend of £1m+.

Have experience with a suite of digital marketing skills, including: Facebook/Instagram Ads, Google, Bing, SEM, SEO, GTM, Analytics, and A-B testing tools and techniques.

Can create content that speaks to our customers.

Are curious, intelligent, and creative.

jobs.title: Customer Experience Specialist
jobs.description:
Please note: To apply for for this role, please contact lee@inthehiddencity.com with an expression of interest. You will then be sent a link to an online application form to complete.

--

HiddenCity creates real-world adventure games for adults. Players solve clues sent to their phone on a journey through the city. They unlock secret locations, interact with people they meet, and solve challenges. Experiences are critically acclaimed, with coverage from BBC News, Time Out London, Evening Standard and more. HiddenCity partners have included The Guardian, Eastpak, and the City Of London Corporation. Customers rate HiddenCity, on average, 4.6 out of 5 stars.

There are currently nine games live which can be played every day of the week. Moriarty's Game is HiddenCity's most developed game, which sees players challenge Sherlock Holmes' nemesis. Players’ decisions influence where they go and the outcome of the story.



Your primary role is to help players enjoy HiddenCity games at their best:

- Be the first point of contact for customers and venues.

- Proactively manage corporate bookings.

- Raise game issues to the game support team.

- Respond to email and social media using the customer support platform Zendesk.

- Receive phone calls routed to your mobile phone.

- Follow the Customer Experience Guide, and update this where necessary.

- Check stock at venues across central London, on a weekly basis.



Expect to spend some of your time supporting other areas of the business, helping to make sure the team functions, for the CEO and project managers. This could include:

- Coordinating team meetings.

- Organising team events.

- Supporting business finances.

- Researching locations for new games.

How you’ll work:

- On weekdays you'll typically work from the office, the co-working space, Impact Hub, near Old Street

- You'll be part of a team of ten people at HiddenCity, most of whom are part time.

- On weekends you can work remotely, and some days in the week.



What you’ll get:

- Competitive salary.

- Opportunity for career progression.

- Experience of working with a startup in a new and growing industry.

- A varied role including with work both in the office and on location.

- Membership to Impact Hub Islington. The opportunity to get involved with community events.

- Familiarity with customer support tools such as Zendesk, Trello and Slack.

- Complimentary experiences for you and your friends.



You'll need:

- Modern laptop.

- Smart phone.

- A good internet connection, for wherever you may do remote work (eg on weekends)

- Requirements



Who you are:

- Highly organised. Able to manage a range of priorities and deliver within tight deadlines

- Adept at problem solving - expect a challenge relating to this before you join.

- Playful. You enjoy playing games, in any form - board games, computer games, sports, they're all games.

- Entrepreneurial. You see opportunities to improve or adapt the business.

- Fit. You'll be spending some time each week navigating to locations, on foot.

- Friendly, creative, a people person.

- A confident and tactful communicator: written, in person and on the phone.

- Self-sufficient, a fast learner.

- Enjoy being part of a team.



It's essential that you have the following experience:

- Technically savvy

- Working work people in a customer-focussed role

- Competent with Google Drive & Google Docs


If you have experience of any of the following you could propose a rate at the higher end of the proposed pay range:

- Customer experience.

- Sales.

- Managing teams.

- Financial literacy.

- Process design.

- Supporting startups grow.

Your work will be about identifying problems and delivering solutions, so expect an application process that will enable you to test your problem solving skills and demonstrate your creativity. Have fun with it.
